body.p: Judicial body vested with authority over civil and criminal matters. The first Supreme Court consisted of three justices, with each serving seven-year terms. In 1850, it expanded from three to five justices, with each serving six-year terms. Civil War-era Justice(s): Andrew Davidson (1853-1865), James M. Hanna (1857-1865), James L. Worden (1858-1865), James S. Frazer (1865-1871), Jehu T. Elliott (1865-1871), Charles A. Ray (1865-1871), and Robert C. Gregory (1865-1871).
